intro: Leuconymphaea undulata, commonly known as the wavy-leaved water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that have a distinctive wavy or undulating margin. The plant typically grows in shallow, still waters such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually submerged, and it reproduces both sexually and asexually through spores. This plant plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to aquatic life.
